content: This Is Thier Pink Slip While all attention was fixated on the totally controlled presidential race, everyone ignored the heart of the problem, the Congress! The powers-that-be con everyone into believing all the power lies with El Presidente. Well, it doesn't my friends. The Congress has more power than the executive branch and . . . THE CONGRESS HAS AUTHORIZED EVERYTHING THAT'S HAPPENING The President has no Constitutional authority to do most of the things they claim they can do. They can only ask the Congress to do what they want. The Congress could have stopped everything that's happening; the wars, the Wall Street takeover, the TRILLION DOLLAR defense budget they just passed. Our so-called representatives have sold us out so many times it makes my head spin and what do we all do? We not only let them keep their jobs, but you watch, they will most likely give themselves a raise, like they always do, for the fine job of screwing us they've done over the last two years. The way we hold our representatives accountable is to let them keep their $174,000 a year jobs so they can stick it to us for another two years! In case you're wondering, that's $14,500 a month, which includes another $4,700.00 raise they just gave themselves. *http://www.kickthemallout.com/index.php?msg=48* This message has been edited. Last edited by: EOCRon, Wed 15 April 2009 09:24 AM SEABEE'S "CAN DO", "HAVE DONE", AND WILL DO SO FOREVER. GOD BLESS AMERICA

title: IT IS TIME TO FIRE THEM ALL AND START FRESH
IT IS TIME TO FIRE THEM ALL AND START FRESH

content: That's been the rally cry I've rallied round for a while now, 2008 specifically. Didn't do much good. How can we allow these entrenched, overpaid and compensated, special-interest puppet, self-serving basturds continue to stick it to us like this. Nearly every week I send off an email to my DC critters expressing this very sentement, to which their zombies return a "thanks for contacting" so-and-so. I'm certain a cadre of interns does all that while the demi-gods snicker over caviar and wine. For the total compensation package they get, I'd think/hope they'd at least read proposed legislation before putting ink to it...a $trillion later, no such luck. One observation re: the OP - theoretically congress does not have more power than the presidency. We're supposed to have 3 equally powerful branches: Admin Executive (damnit), Judicial, congress and Legislature- balance of power and all that. But, agreed, El Presidente is supposed to only be able to request/suggest bills, then twist congressional arms till some lakey does his bidding. This message has been edited. Last edited by: cheapthrills, Wed 15 April 2009 04:49 PM

content: A $174K salary. That is a crime, giving themselves a 4,700.00 raise is a crime. We the people should decide if they get a raise, if any, and how much. There should be a salary cap, no more than $80k If they don't shape up, we the people should decide if they get fired, not their buddies. If we stick with the present system none of them will get fired. When they retire, they should get limited medical, the co pay should be 80%. This message has been edited. Last edited by: Bergy46, Wed 15 April 2009 08:13 PM Keep smiling, everyone will wonder what you've been up to!

content: all post here have said "hit the road Jack"... now the big question...... how many here are willing to vote, not necessarily the lessor of two evils or party lines, but willing to vote for the unknown canidate because they could not possibly be any worse then the existing incumbent? Unless the person running, and it only seems at the local level, is doing a good job of expressing the will of the majority I vote for the unknown. Some may say, "you waste your vote" but I liken it to be the same as saying "none of the above". WE NEED TO SEND A MESSAGE!!! These POS's need to realize they work for us and not their personal interest. One Flag......One Heart......One Nation............EVERMORE

content: It can only be classified as a bizarre and not so amusing sidebar issue to hear the unclassified report from Department of Homeland Security's Secretary Napolitano presenting governmental ideology suggesting trained and proven United States military service personnel returning home are possible candidates in being radicalized; posing a potential danger/threat to the United States of America. Leave the political, radicalized, ideological banter arising from the gutter where it belongs . . . in Washington DC. OR, focus on this country's real threats in a realistic, competent and complete manner . . . which calls for understanding what it means to be a true statesman. God bless America and the people of the United States.
